page.title: 08NEWTON HALL WILDLIFE (1)
page.content: Newton Hall is one of the largest urban developments in Europe yet it can boast a wealth of nature.In early times the area was mainly marsh and woodland but the marsh has been drained.In the middle of the estate there is evidence of former woods.At the North end there is HOPPER WOOD and at the South, BRASSIDE PONDS,with its wealth of marsh and pond life. The estate can boast a wealth of trees eg OAK,ELM,BEECH,BIRCH,LARCH,WILD CHERRY OF THE WOODLAND.Around the houses there is - LABURNUM,POPLAR,HOLLY,CHESTNUT, ROWAN, SYCAMORE and YEW - many of these a legacy of William Leech the builder. The old pathways contain HAWTHORN,CRAB APPLE,ELDERBURY and DOG ROSE.
